attributes.background:
Trefor Pier update. 

£250k is needed to save derelict pier, 


The long-standing pier in the village of Trefor is facing demolition,unless £250,000 is forthcoming to restore the structure to its former glory,members of the Dwyfor area services committee have been told. 
In a report to the committee,the county's head of lifelong services, Rhys Wyn Parri,warned that the only practical option will be to demolish the pier, 

Gwynedd council had embarked £80,000 to try to resolve the situation, 
Cllr Evans said, ''I appreciate that there is a financial problem, and bearing in mind that the pier was only used by fishermen, it would seem that the structure will need to be demolished''
